Source Code

  1import astroid
  2from astroid import nodes
  3from typing import List, Dict, Any
  4
  5class FrameworkSpecificSmellDetector:
  6    def __init__(self):
  7        self.smells: List[Dict[str, str]] = []
  8        self.framework_smells = self.get_smells()
  9
 10    def detect_smells(self, file_path: str) -> List[Dict[str, str]]:
 11        with open(file_path, 'r') as file:
 12            content = file.read()
 13        module = astroid.parse(content)
 14        self.visit_module(module)
 15        return self.smells
 16
 17    def visit_module(self, node: nodes.Module):
 18        self.check_imports(node)
 19        self.check_pandas_smells(node)
 20        self.check_numpy_smells(node)
 21        self.check_sklearn_smells(node)
 22        self.check_tensorflow_smells(node)
 23        self.check_pytorch_smells(node)
 24
 25    def add_smell(self, framework: str, smell_name: str):
 26        smell = next((s for s in self.framework_smells[framework] if s['name'] == smell_name), None)
 27        if smell:
 28            self.smells.append(smell)
 29
 30    def check_imports(self, node: nodes.Module):
 31        for import_node in node.nodes_of_class((nodes.Import, nodes.ImportFrom)):
 32            if isinstance(import_node, nodes.Import):
 33                for name, alias in import_node.names:
 34                    if name == 'numpy' and alias != 'np':
 35                        self.add_smell('General', 'Import Checker')
 36                    elif name == 'pandas' and alias != 'pd':
 37                        self.add_smell('General', 'Import Checker')
 38            elif isinstance(import_node, nodes.ImportFrom):
 39                if import_node.modname == 'numpy' and any(alias != 'np' for _, alias in import_node.names):
 40                    self.add_smell('General', 'Import Checker')
 41                elif import_node.modname == 'pandas' and any(alias != 'pd' for _, alias in import_node.names):
 42                    self.add_smell('General', 'Import Checker')
 43
 44    def check_pandas_smells(self, node: nodes.Module):
 45        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
 46            if 'iterrows' in call.func.as_string():
 47                self.add_smell('Pandas', 'Unnecessary Iteration')
 48            if 'merge' in call.func.as_string() and not any(kw.arg in ['how', 'on', 'validate'] for kw in call.keywords):
 49                self.add_smell('Pandas', 'Merge Parameter Checker')
 50            if 'inplace=True' in call.as_string():
 51                self.add_smell('Pandas', 'InPlace Checker')
 52            if '.values' in call.as_string():
 53                self.add_smell('Pandas', 'DataFrame Conversion Checker')
 54            if 'read_csv' in call.func.as_string() and not any(kw.arg == 'dtype' for kw in call.keywords):
 55                self.add_smell('Pandas', 'Datatype Checker')
 56
 57        for subscript in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Subscript):
 58            if isinstance(subscript.value, nodes.Subscript):
 59                self.add_smell('Pandas', 'Chain Indexing')
 60
 61        for assign in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Assign):
 62            if isinstance(assign.targets[0], nodes.Subscript) and isinstance(assign.targets[0].value, nodes.Name):
 63                self.add_smell('Pandas', 'DataFrame Iteration Modification')
 64
 65        if not any('[[' in subscript.as_string() for subscript in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Subscript)):
 66            self.add_smell('Pandas', 'Column Selection Checker')
 67
 68    def check_numpy_smells(self, node: nodes.Module):
 69        for compare in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Compare):
 70            if any('np.nan' in getattr(op[0], 'as_string', lambda: '')() for op in compare.ops):
 71                self.add_smell('NumPy', 'NaN Equality Checker')
 72
 73        if not any('np.random.seed' in getattr(call.func, 'as_string', lambda: '')() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
 74            self.add_smell('NumPy', 'Randomness Control Checker')
 75
 76    def check_sklearn_smells(self, node: nodes.Module):
 77        scaling_methods = ['StandardScaler', 'MinMaxScaler', 'RobustScaler']
 78        if any(method in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call) for method in scaling_methods):
 79            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Scaler Missing Checker')
 80
 81        if not any('Pipeline' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
 82            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Pipeline Checker')
 83
 84        if not any('cross_val_score' in call.func.as_string() or 'KFold' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
 85            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Cross Validation Checker')
 86
 87        if not any('random_state' in kw.arg for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call) for kw in call.keywords):
 88            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Randomness Control Checker')
 89
 90        if not any('verbose=True' in call.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
 91            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Verbose Mode Checker')
 92
 93        if not any('roc_auc_score' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
 94            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Dependent Threshold Checker')
 95
 96        if not any('unittest' in imp.names[0][0] or 'pytest' in imp.names[0][0] for imp in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.ImportFrom)):
 97            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Unit Testing Checker')
 98
 99        if not any('train_test_split' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
100            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Data Leakage Checker')
101
102        if not any(isinstance(node, nodes.Try) for node in node.body):
103            self.add_smell('ScikitLearn', 'Exception Handling Checker')
104
105    def check_tensorflow_smells(self, node: nodes.Module):
106        if not any('tf.random.set_seed' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
107            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Randomness Control Checker')
108
109        if not any('tf.keras.callbacks.EarlyStopping' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
110            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Early Stopping Checker')
111
112        if not any('tf.keras.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
113            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Checkpointing Checker')
114
115        if not any('tf.keras.backend.clear_session' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
116            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Memory Release Checker')
117
118        if not any('tf.math.log' in call.func.as_string() and len(call.args) > 1 for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
119            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Mask Missing Checker')
120
121        if not any('tf.TensorArray' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
122            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Tensor Array Checker')
123
124        if not any('tf.keras.metrics.AUC' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
125            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Dependent Threshold Checker')
126
127        if not any('tf.summary' in call.func.as_string() or 'TensorBoard' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
128            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Logging Checker')
129
130        if not any('tf.keras.layers.BatchNormalization' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
131            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Batch Normalisation Checker')
132
133        if not any('tf.keras.layers.Dropout' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
134            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Dropout Usage Checker')
135
136        if not any('tf.keras.preprocessing.image.ImageDataGenerator' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
137            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Data Augmentation Checker')
138
139        if not any('tf.keras.callbacks.LearningRateScheduler' in call.func.as_string() or 'tf.keras.optimizers.schedules' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
140            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Learning Rate Scheduler Checker')
141
142        if not any('model.evaluate' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
143            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Model Evaluation Checker')
144
145        if not any('tf.test.TestCase' in base.as_string() for cls in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.ClassDef) for base in cls.bases):
146            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Unit Testing Checker')
147
148        if not any(isinstance(node, nodes.Try) for node in node.body):
149            self.add_smell('TensorFlow', 'Exception Handling Checker')
150
151    def check_pytorch_smells(self, node: nodes.Module):
152        if not any('torch.manual_seed' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
153            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Randomness Control Checker')
154
155        if not any('torch.use_deterministic_algorithms' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
156            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Deterministic Algorithm Usage Checker')
157
158        if not any('DataLoader' in call.func.as_string() and 'worker_init_fn' in call.as_string() and 'generator' in call.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
159            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Randomness Control Checker (PyTorch-Dataloader)')
160
161        if not any('torch.log' in call.func.as_string() and len(call.args) > 1 for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
162            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Mask Missing Checker')
163
164        if any('net.forward' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
165            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Net Forward Checker')
166
167        if not any('optimizer.zero_grad' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
168            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Gradient Clear Checker')
169
170        if not any('torch.nn.BatchNorm' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
171            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Batch Normalisation Checker')
172
173        if not any('torch.nn.Dropout' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
174            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Dropout Usage Checker')
175
176        if not any('torchvision.transforms' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
177            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Data Augmentation Checker')
178
179        if not any('torch.optim.lr_scheduler' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
180            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Learning Rate Scheduler Checker')
181
182        if not any('tensorboardX' in imp.names[0][0] or 'SummaryWriter' in imp.names[0][0] for imp in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.ImportFrom)):
183            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Logging Checker')
184
185        if not any('model.eval()' in call.func.as_string() for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
186            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Model Evaluation Checker')
187
188        if not any('unittest' in imp.names[0][0] or 'pytest' in imp.names[0][0] for imp in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.ImportFrom)):
189            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Unit Testing Checker')
190
191        if not any(isinstance(node, nodes.Try) for node in node.body):
192            self.add_smell('PyTorch', 'Exception Handling Checker')
193
194    def get_smells(self) -> Dict[str, List[Dict[str, str]]]:
195        return {
196            "General": [
197                {
198                    "name": "Import Checker",
199                    "how_to_fix": "Use standard naming conventions for imported modules.",
200                    "benefits": "Improves code readability and maintainability.",
201                    "strategies": "Follow standard naming conventions (e.g., import numpy as np)."
202                }
203            ],
204            "Pandas": [
205                {
206                    "name": "Unnecessary Iteration",
207                    "how_to_fix": "Use vectorized operations instead of loops.",
208                    "benefits": "Enhances performance and reduces execution time.",
209                    "strategies": "Replace loops with Pandas vectorized functions (e.g., apply, map, vectorized arithmetic operations)."
210                },
211                {
212                    "name": "DataFrame Iteration Modification",
213                    "how_to_fix": "Avoid modifying DataFrame during iteration.",
214                    "benefits": "Prevents unexpected behaviour and potential data corruption.",
215                    "strategies": "Use temporary variables or vectorized operations for modifications."
216                },
217                {
218                    "name": "Chain Indexing",
219                    "how_to_fix": "Use single indexing or .loc[], .iloc[] methods.",
220                    "benefits": "Enhances code readability and prevents performance issues.",
221                    "strategies": "Use .loc[] or .iloc[] for DataFrame indexing instead of chained indexing."
222                },
223                {
224                    "name": "Datatype Checker",
225                    "how_to_fix": "Set data types explicitly when importing data.",
226                    "benefits": "Ensures correct data format and reduces memory usage.",
227                    "strategies": "Use dtype parameter in Pandas read functions (e.g., pd.read_csv)."
228                },
229                {
230                    "name": "Column Selection Checker",
231                    "how_to_fix": "Select necessary columns after importing DataFrame.",
232                    "benefits": "Clarifies data usage and improves performance.",
233                    "strategies": "Use column selection methods (e.g., df[['col1', 'col2']])."
234                },
235                {
236                    "name": "Merge Parameter Checker",
237                    "how_to_fix": "Specify how, on, and validate parameters in merge operations.",
238                    "benefits": "Ensures accurate data merging and prevents data loss.",
239                    "strategies": "Use appropriate parameters in pd.merge function."
240                },
241                {
242                    "name": "InPlace Checker",
243                    "how_to_fix": "Assign operations to a new DataFrame variable.",
244                    "benefits": "Prevents data loss and improves code clarity.",
245                    "strategies": "Assign operation results to a new variable instead of using inplace=True."
246                },
247                {
248                    "name": "DataFrame Conversion Checker",
249                    "how_to_fix": "Use .to_numpy() instead of .values.",
250                    "benefits": "Ensures future compatibility and avoids unexpected behaviour.",
251                    "strategies": "Replace .values with .to_numpy() in Pandas DataFrame conversion."
252                }

266                }

290                    "benefits": "Ensures reproducible results and consistent model behaviour.",

435                {
436                    "name": "Mask Missing Checker",
437                    "how_to_fix": "Ensure valid arguments for log functions.",
438                    "benefits": "Prevents numerical errors and improves model stability.",
439                    "strategies": "Validate arguments before using log functions."
440                },
441                {
442                    "name": "Net Forward Checker",
443                    "how_to_fix": "Use self.net() instead of self.net.forward().",
444                    "benefits": "Improves code readability and maintains consistency with PyTorch practices.",
445                    "strategies": "Replace self.net.forward() with self.net()."
446                },
447                {
448                    "name": "Gradient Clear Checker",
449                    "how_to_fix": "Use optimizer.zero_grad() before loss.backward() and optimizer.step().",
450                    "benefits": "Ensures correct gradient computation and prevents accumulation.",
451                    "strategies": "Include optimizer.zero_grad() in the training loop."
452                },
453                {
454                    "name": "Batch Normalisation Checker",
455                    "how_to_fix": "Use batch normalisation layers to improve training stability.",
456                    "benefits": "Enhances model performance and convergence speed.",
457                    "strategies": "Incorporate torch.nn.BatchNorm1d, torch.nn.BatchNorm2d, etc., into the model."
458                },
459                {
460                    "name": "Dropout Usage Checker",
461                    "how_to_fix": "Use dropout layers to mitigate overfitting.",
462                    "benefits": "Prevents overfitting and enhances generalisation of the model.",
463                    "strategies": "Add torch.nn.Dropout layers to the neural network."
464                },
465                {
466                    "name": "Data Augmentation Checker",
467                    "how_to_fix": "Implement data augmentation to increase dataset diversity.",
468                    "benefits": "Enhances model performance and reduces overfitting.",
469                    "strategies": "Use torchvision.transforms for applying data augmentation techniques."
470                },
471                {
472                    "name": "Learning Rate Scheduler Checker",
473                    "how_to_fix": "Use learning rate schedulers for better training optimisation.",
474                    "benefits": "Enhances training efficiency and model accuracy.",
475                    "strategies": "Implement torch.optim.lr_scheduler for dynamic learning rate adjustments."
476                },
477                {
478                    "name": "Logging Checker",
479                    "how_to_fix": "Use logging for tracking experiments and results.",
480                    "benefits": "Helps in tracking training progress and diagnosing issues.",
481                    "strategies": "Use logging frameworks such as tensorboardX or logging module in PyTorch."
482                },
483                {
484                    "name": "Model Evaluation Checker",
485                    "how_to_fix": "Continuously evaluate model on validation/test datasets.",
486                    "benefits": "Prevents overfitting and ensures robust performance.",
487                    "strategies": "Implement periodic evaluation logic within the training loop."
488                },
489                {
490                    "name": "Unit Testing Checker",
491                    "how_to_fix": "Implement unit tests for PyTorch components and models.",
492                    "benefits": "Improves code quality and reduces chances of errors.",
493                    "strategies": "Write unit tests using unittest or pytest for PyTorch code."
494                },
495                {
496                    "name": "Exception Handling Checker",
497                    "how_to_fix": "Use exception handling to manage potential errors during model operations.",
498                    "benefits": "Ensures graceful handling of errors and robustness of the code.",
499                    "strategies": "Implement try-except blocks to catch and manage exceptions in PyTorch code."
500                }
501            ]
502        }
503
504    def generate_report(self) -> str:
505        report = "Framework-Specific Code Smell Report\n====================================\n\n"
506        for smell in self.smells:
507            report += f"Framework: {next(fw for fw, smells in self.framework_smells.items() if smell in smells)}\n"
508            report += f"Smell: {smell['name']}\n"
509            report += f"How to Fix: {smell['how_to_fix']}\n"
510            report += f"Benefits: {smell['benefits']}\n"
511            report += f"Strategies: {smell['strategies']}\n\n"
512        report += f"Total smells detected: {len(self.smells)}"
513        return report
